text: hi everyone, in our company we're working a lot with objects from HubSpot, in particular companies and deals - e.g. we use them to check integrity (making sure our commercial people didn't break anything), to keep our platform up-to-date etc. For that we need to fetch all the companies and deals every day. We're currently doing it via API endpoints `/deals/v1/deal/paged` and `companies/v2/companies/paged`. I'm aware that these are now outdated and e.g. for companies there now is `/crm/v3/objects/companies` :HubSpotheart: However, before I migrate our infrastructure onto the new endpoint, I wonder - isn't there a more efficient way to fetch all companies and deals? The one way I know about is manual CSV export, but that's manual, so clearly not useful for our automated solution. Thanks a lot in advance!

Hi everyone! I am in the process of creating a custom object through the api & I noticed the documentation says that the object fields can't be edited once created but will I be able to add properties through the front end after I create it or do all the properties need to be created through the API? Thanks in advance :slightly_smiling_face:
Hey <@UMA5B6XJ6> where do you see that in our docs?  You can create more properties via the API for custom objects using the properties API
Geez, I'm rereading them now and I must have had my wires crossed, my apologies.

Hi All,
I'm trying to validate webhooks calls from HubSpot with the header <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/faq/v2-request-validation|X-HubSpot-Signature>
But in case there are query params, the order of the params is unknown (to me), so I need to try with all permutation (which make no sense, in one case I have 6 parameters which are 720 permutation, if I will have 7 we are getting to 5,040, and so forth).
Is there I way to know the order, is there a logic to it?
Thanks,
Gal
